attributes.action: regulate libellous and damaging content posted freely by bloggers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This petition is to regulate web content to bring it in line with more traditional media types such as newspapers which are covered by the press complaints commission. With the effect that bloggers are regarded in their own right as "press editors" and should write responsibly with the following points taken into consideration:
i) They must not publish inaccurate, misleading, libellous or distorted information.
ii) An inaccuracy, misleading statement or distortion once recognised must be corrected, promptly and with due prominence – and an apology published.
iii) They must distinguish clearly between comment, conjecture and fact.
iv) Any internet entry must report fairly and accurately the outcome of an action for defamation to which it has been a party.
v) Everyone is entitled to respect for his or her private and family life, home, health and correspondence, including digital communications. Editors will be expected to justify intrusions into any individual's private life without consent.
